data.title: Babel: Line numbers when specs fail are from transpiled file.
data.body:
Running tests:
![](https://cdn.discourse.org/business/uploads/github_atom/original/3X/a/4/a46dc79a2e4a783e423f06453b4d332deb342f44.png)

Checking source code file at row 784: 
![](https://cdn.discourse.org/business/uploads/github_atom/original/3X/8/c/8c39d14a261567fbcd5572c64418c81f3e8383c3.png)
That's not it. Neither `warning` nor `error` is part of this...

The actual error is found further down in the file:
![](https://cdn.discourse.org/business/uploads/github_atom/original/3X/a/9/a937c28f777b88e2bd83fe0db5d4b55f09aa357b.png)

I transpiled the file manually using babel, and voila (at row 784):
![](https://cdn.discourse.org/business/uploads/github_atom/original/3X/f/b/fbe069f8745480980320657221b3ebcadcf855e0.png)

data.title: Manual updating breaks release notes page
data.body: The button "Restart and update" will simply quit Atom without doing anything else.

data.title: Update to Octicons 3.0
data.body:
The Octicons got [updated to 3.0](https://github.com/github/octicons/pull/58). There are some visual changes, but also some icons got removed and some new ones added.

It's not that straightforward to update them, since some of the community packages might use some of the icons that got removed.. like the `alignment`, `move`, `jump` icons.

A few options:
1. Update to Octicons 3.0. Packages might need to make changes or add their own icons.
2. "Manually" update to Octicons 3.0 and still keep the ones that got removed. There should be no name conflicts.
3. Keep the current Octicons as is.
4. Keep the current Octicons as is (at least until Atom 2.0). And add an additional "Atom icons set". Could be a fork of the Octicons 3.0 and modified to Atom's needs. Class names could be `atom-icon` or so. The find + replace already uses some custom icons. Also having custom icons for autocomplete-plus would be nice.

data.title: activationHooks: grammar-used doesn't work when restoring a session
data.body:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Take a package with `activationHooks: grammar-used`
2. Verify that it activates when a file with given grammar is open
3. Restart Atom, e.g. with ctrl-alt-r (or platform equivalent)

Here is a video that should hopefully illustrate the problem:
https://youtu.be/0viUxFNS-jc

Notice how bottom panel shows up when I open/reopen a file, but NOT when I restart Atom

data.title: Switch to Contributor Covenant from Open Code of Conduct
data.body:
Switch to the [Contributor Covenant](http://contributor-covenant.org/version/1/2/0/) from the [Open Code of Conduct](http://todogroup.org/opencodeofconduct).

See https://github.com/todogroup/opencodeofconduct/issues/84 for more details.

See [here](http://contributor-covenant.org/#who) for other projects using the Contributor Covenant.

/cc @atom/feedback 

Closes #8206

data.title: Can not disable linebreak at end of file
data.body:
Atom is adding a linebreak at the end of a file.
This behavior can not be disabled (as I know) and is problematic for eg. developing PHP scripts.
Every character in an included PHP file that comes after the closing tag "?>" will prevent me from sending headers.
(I know that I could remove the closing PHP tag, but a editor souldn't tell me how to programm.)

Using Atom 1.0.5 (portable) on Windows 7 x64

data.title: Arrow Keys don't scroll up/down in package search
data.body: Arrow Keys don't scroll up/down in package search results.  Also can't scroll with mouse or page up/ page down.

data.title: Cannot open anything in Dev Mode
data.body:
I get this crash when the editor tries to open in Dev Mode. I deleted `~/.atom` and Atom.app and tried opening again in Dev Mode and still the same error. It's been happening for the last 3 months.

```
Error: Cannot find module 'coffee-cash'
    at Function.Module._resolveFilename (module.js:328)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:270)
    at Module.require (module.js:357)
    at require (module.js:376)
    at setupCoffeeCache (index.js:96)
    at setupWindow (index.js:68)
    at window.onload (index.js:32)
```

"quick jump" between indents is buggy (and useless IMHO, but that is more of #3174 topic).

Check example here: http://youtu.be/grQyFxLhOd8
This happens with latest Atom, in safe mode, Linux.

data.title: allow package developers to create OS global keybindings
data.body:
It seems like Electron has API for this (https://github.com/atom/electron/blob/master/docs/api/global-shortcut.md) but you cannot use it for package creation.

Any way to fix that?

data.title: dragging a file in the editor cause black screen
data.body:
When you drag-and-drop a file in the editor, this cause a "crash": the screen is black and the only thing you can do is to `cmd`+`q` (not forcing).

The file in question is a `c file`, `"norminette.c"`.
Atom is in `full screen` with just `one pane`.
`autocomplete-clang`, `linter`, `linter-clang`, `tab-control` are installed (and others, ...)

After this closing, Atom doesn't save my panes and my tree-view...

The file in question is from another desktop on my mac.

Macbook pro retina end 2013, 2,6 GHz Intel Core i5, 8Go of ram

data.title: Dragging file into window makes it unusable
data.body: If you drag a file on Windows 7 into atom window, internal browser opens it instead and none atom controls work since then.

data.title: Failing OS X builds on Travis CI
data.body:
The OS X builds on Travis CI are currently quite consistently failing a singular test;

```
TextEditorComponent
  gutter rendering
    fold decorations
      mouse interactions with fold indicators
        when the component is destroyed
          it stops listening for folding events
            Error: No animation frame requested
              at noAnimationFrame (/Users/travis/build/atom/atom/spec/text-editor-component-spec.coffee:22:39)
              at [object Object].<anonymous> (/Users/travis/build/atom/atom/spec/text-editor-component-spec.coffee:827:13)
```

For a concrete example of a failing build, see https://travis-ci.org/atom/atom/jobs/74894506#L276.
This is also happening against [`master` builds](https://travis-ci.org/atom/atom/jobs/74537917#L265).

Seems to be related to gutter components. It has happened in the past, but infrequently, but seems to happen quite consistently now. Timing related perhaps? :racehorse: 

/cc @as-cii

data.title: pane:move-item-left/right, tab jumps two places
data.body: When I use the key bindings ctrl-shift-left and right, the tab jumps two steps. It looks like the key binding is defined in two places and is called for each one. The screenshot is open in safe mode and my keymap.cson is empty. Atom 1.0.5 OSX 10.10.4

data.title: Can't scroll to the very edge of the window
data.body:
I'm having an issue with the scroll bar at the very edge of the window. Most apps will let you just drag your mouse at the very edge of the window and would let you scroll the content. I'm not sure if this is intended feature or something but it would be really nice to just move the scroll bar at the very edge so you don't need to focus your cursor all the time to scroll. :)

![scroll](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6686328/9168925/1780392c-3f8c-11e5-82bf-58f6b34e4337.png)

Atom version: `1.0.5`
OS/Platform: **Windows 10 PC**

data.title: Build fails while downloading atom
data.body:
While installing [atom-editor-bin](https://aur.archlinux.org/packages/atom-editor-bin/) through yaourt on arch-linux, downloading step fails each time with error - `curl: (56) SSL read: error:00000000:lib(0):func(0):reason(0), errno 104`. Another thing to note is, process of downloading is started everytime successfully but downloading fails only on 5% or 6%.

Here is remaining output from yaourt:

```
==> ERROR: Failure while downloading atom-amd64-v1.0.5.deb
    Aborting...
==> ERROR: Makepkg was unable to build atom-editor-bin.
```

Also are there any other hosts that contain up to date builds of atom so that I could edit PKGBUILD with relevant url.

data.title: Update linux.md
data.body: Adding Mageia instructions (based on [#8283](https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/8283)). Adding extra troubleshooting information.

data.title: Overlay items flicker when near the edge of the window
data.body:
This happens frequently when using the [Hydrogen package](https://github.com/willwhitney/hydrogen), which displays the return values from evaluated code as overlays on the window. It seems to be exacerbated when there are more overlays. It looks like the layout engine is trying to figure out where to render them but the act of rendering changes the location solution, so they start flickering like crazy.

Originally filed as an issue on Hydrogen: willwhitney/hydrogen#93, but it seems this is an issue with the Atom rendering.

data.title: Package's `deactivate` callback doesn't seem to be called when Atom window is closed/reloaded
data.body:
From the [docs](https://atom.io/docs/latest/creating-a-package#source-code):

> - `deactivate()`: This **optional** method is called when the window is shutting down, or when your package is being updated or disabled. If your package is watching any files, holding external resources, providing commands or subscribing to events, release them here.

If I disable the package manually through the Settings interface, the `deactivate` callback is called as expected. However, if I close or reload Atom (ctrl+alt+r / cmd+ctrl+alt+l), the `deactivate` callback is not called at all. I'm testing this by adding a `console.log` to the `deactivate` callback and reloading Atom while having the DevTools console open with the "Preserve log" option enabled.

Use case: I'm developing a package which spawns child processes. I'd like to kill them when Atom closes.

Is this a bug or am I doing something wrong?
Running Atom 1.0.5 on Windows 10.

Here's the package's [source code](https://github.com/UltCombo/ult-terminal/blob/0061f89db5fc37a50f7b17a71e8b1d653f95d61c/lib/ult-terminal.coffee#L16-L17).

data.title: Specs window is not maximized
data.body:
When opening the Run Atom/Package Specs window, it is not maximized, but the window itself is the same height and width that a maximized window should be.  The result is that parts of the window are slightly offscreen:
![specs window maximized](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2766036/9155561/ee5b57be-3e89-11e5-95d1-25602d939efd.png)

Also, it starts out at a nice size in the center of the screen, but I'm guessing once the window initializes it automatically tries to maximize itself:
![specs window normal](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2766036/9155594/6bffeec8-3e8a-11e5-9ab7-4ace1b6a3091.png)

Refs #3276 which fixed the general Atom window bug.

Also, while I'm on this topic, it would be nice if Atom windows could maximize _immediately_ after showing up - they currently start as un-maximized until everything loads.

data.title: Atom on Linux uses hard coded icon.
data.body:
I'm running Linux on my box.
I use different app icon. And in the menu the icon is right. But when run, Atom still uses it's default one, which looks terrible on HiDPI screen.

data.title: Git LFS confuses Atom's git change detection.
data.body:
When a file is added to Git LFS and pushed Atom still thinks the file has changed and highlights it in orange even though it has already been pushed up to Github.

I am pretty sure this is the wrong repo to post this on but if you point me to the proper one I will move it.

data.title: ANSI encoding?
data.body:
Test file: https://gist.github.com/rugk/63e276db7ddcef498008

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a new TXT file with Notepad++
2. Make sure the encoding is set to ANSI.
3. Paste my test text in it.
4. Save the file.
5. Open it in Atom.

What happens: It will be detected as UTF-8 and displayed completely broken:
![ansiencodingissue](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11966684/9155152/cc5f6d24-3eae-11e5-9ff8-c10ff4d7fd12.PNG)

What should happen: Detecting and encoding as ANSI.

Interestingly there is not even any possibility to select ANSI encoding if you click on UTF-8 in the status bar. There is just no entry.

Possibly related issues: https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/7553, https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/8219, https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/7899

```
2.  键盘布局:

            xkb_keymap {
                xkb_keycodes  { include "evdev+aliases(qwerty)" };
                xkb_types     { include "complete"  };
                xkb_compat    { include "complete"  };

            C
            en_US.utf8
            POSIX
            zh_CN.gbk
            zh_CN.utf8

    2.  当前 locale:

            LANG=zh_CN.UTF-8
            LC_CTYPE=zh_CN.UTF-8

        当前 fcitx 设置目录是 `~/.config/fcitx` (`/home/light4/.config/fcitx`)。

5.  当前用户：

    脚本作为 light4 (1000) 运行。

# Fcitx 状态:
1.  可执行文件:

    在 `/usr/bin/fcitx` 找到了 fcitx.

            fcitx-qw

3.  插件库: 

    所有插件所需的库都被找到。

4.  用户界面:

    找到了 2 个已启用的用户界面插件:

        fcitx-classic-ui
        fcitx-kimpanel-ui

## 输入法:
1.  找到了 4 个启用的输入法:

        fcitx-keyboard-us
        sunpinyin
        pinyin
        rime

2.  默认输入法:

    您已经正确的将一个键盘输入法 "fcitx-keyboard-us" 设为默认.

# 日志:
1.  `date`:

        2015年 07月 20日 星期一 13:17:24 CST

2.  `~/.config/fcitx/log/`:

        总用量 0

3.  `~/.config/fcitx/log/crash.log`:

    `~/.config/fcitx/log/crash.log` 未找到.

```

data.title: chinese chars becomes 〄〄〄 in version 0.209.0 on ubuntu 14.04 LTS

data.title: Is there a way to inject BrowserWindow options from a user script?
data.body:
It appears that the options for Atom's `BrowserWindow` instance are compiled [here](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/a6d9b0506c1fc4aab1eb7a9ec34cb6047729514c/src/browser/atom-window.coffee#L29).

Is there a way for user scripts to add to / manipulate these options? There are many use cases for this, such as setting the initial window position or enabling the GTK+ dark theme.
